She’s so good-looking, but she looks like a man

This is not the only time the Fab Four have insinuated an attraction towards masculine-looking women.

For example, taking the band’s song “Lovely Rita” from their critically acclaimed eighth studio album  Sgt. Pepper’s Lonely Hearts Club Band, it is evident that there is certainly an attraction towards manly women:

And the bag across her shoulder
Made her look a little like a military man
She’s killer-diller when she’s dressed to the hilt

Killer-diller is used to refer to a musician that really plays all out.

In the context of the lyrics, it means she goes all out when she dresses up.
The expression “to the hilt” also means in full or done to the limit.

This redundancy is used to emphasize how well she dresses.
Yes, you should see Polythene Pam
The name ‘Polythene Pam’ came from the nickname of an early Beatles' fan from the Cavern Club days, named Pat Hodgett (now Dawson), who would often eat polythene.
She’s the kind of a girl that makes “The News of the World”

The News Of The World was a British Sunday tabloid newspaper owned by Rupert Murdoch. Along with its sister paper, The Sun, it was known for pioneering Page Three models- that is, photos of topless girls on page three.
Well, you should see her in drag dressed in her polythene bag
A man who dresses as a woman is said to be “in drag”.
Well, you should see Polythene Pam

A type of vinyl used to make trash bags.



“Polythene” is a British (specifically Liverpudlian – or scouse– colloquialism for the word polyethylene, a plastic material.
A familiar chant from the Beatles' younger days here ironically appropriated for this song.
